notes: The Dallas Stars listed Lundkvist as OUT for Wednesday's (Dec. 18) game against Toronto.

The Golden Knights listed Barbashev as day-to-day with an upper-body injury.
The Dallas Stars listed Harley as OUT for Wednesday's (Dec. 18) game against Toronto.
Johnson is expected to be available for Thursday's (Dec. 19) game against the Devils.
Panarin did not play in Tuesday's (Dec. 17) game against Nashville.
The Wild listed Gustavsson as OUT for Wednesday's (Dec. 18) game against Florida, according to Joe Smith of The Athletic.
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed D Marcus Pettersson on injured reserve on Tuesday (Dec. 17).
Regula was never taken off season-opening injured reserve despite being waived by Boston and claimed by Edmonton on Wednesday, Daniel Nugent-Bowman of The Athletic reports Saturday.
Moore did not play in Tuesday's (Dec. 17) game against Pittsburgh.
Forbort will miss Wednesday's (Dec. 18) game against Utah.
Lauko (lower body) was placed on injured reserve Saturday.
Kuzmenko did not play in Tuesday's (Dec. 17) game against the Bruins.
The Wild listed Trenin as Doubtful for Wednesday's (Dec. 18) game against the Panthers, per Sarah McLellan of the Minneapolis Star Tribune.
Forsberg sustained an undisclosed injury on Saturday (Dec. 14) versus the Penguins and remains without a timeline for return, Bruce Garrioch of Postmedia reports.
Smith did not play in Tuesday's (Dec. 17) game against Capitals.
The Red Wings listed Talbot as OUT for Wednesday's (Dec. 18) game versus the Flyers, per Helene St. James of the Detroit Free Press.
The Lightning said that Moser is considered week-to-week due to a lower-body injury, per Erik Erlendsson of LightningInsider.com.
Faksa did not play in Tuesday's (Dec. 17) game against the Devils.
Kostin (upper body) was put on injured reserve Saturday, per Curtis Pashelka of The San Jose Mercury News.
The Hurricanes said on Tuesday (Dec. 17) that Drury will miss a minimum of four weeks after undergoing hand surgery, per Chip Alexander of The Raleigh News & Observer.
The Minnesota Wild placed D Jake Middleton on injured reserve on Friday (Dec. 13).
The Maple Leafs said on Tuesday (Dec. 17) that Stolarz is expected to miss the next 4-6 weeks after undergoing a procedure to remove a loose body in his knee.
The Dallas Stars placed D Matt Dumba on injured reserve on Wednesday (Dec. 18).
The New York Rangers placed D K'Andre Miller on injured reserve on Friday (Dec. 13).
Gustafsson (concussion) was placed on injured reserve by Winnipeg on Wednesday, per the NHL media site.
Danforth did not play in Tuesday's (Dec. 17) game against Tampa Bay.
The Nashville Predators listed Josi as OUT for Tuesday's (Dec. 17) game versus the Rangers but is possible to return for Thursday's (Dec. 19) game versus the Penguins.
The Utah Hockey Club said on Thursday (Dec. 12) that Bortuzzo did not travel with the team on their current trip and is out indefinitely.
Gourde did not play in Tuesday's (Dec. 17) game against the Senators.
The Nashville Predators listed Carrier as OUT for Tuesday's (Dec. 17) game versus the Rangers but is possible to return for Thursday's (Dec. 19) game versus the Penguins.
The Chicago Blackhawks placed G Petr Mrazek on injured reserve on Saturday (Dec. 7).
The Chicago Blackhawks placed D Alec Martinez on injured reserve on Friday (Dec. 13).
The Philadelphia Flyers placed F Nicolas Deslauriers on injured reserve.
The New York Islanders placed G Semyon Varlamov on injured reserve.
The Minnesota Wild placed F Joel Eriksson Ek on injured reserve on Friday (Dec. 6) and is considered week-to-week.
Zegras had successful knee surgery on Thursday (Dec. 12) to repair a torn meniscus and is expected to miss six weeks.
Dahlin did not play in Tuesday's (Dec. 17) game versus Canadiens but hopes to play against Toronto on Friday (Dec. 20), per Paul Hamilton of WGR Sports Radio 550.
The Los Angeles Kings placed F Trevor Lewis on injured reserve on Wednesday (Dec. 4).

Seguin will be out of action for 4-6 months when he undergoes surgery on Thursday (Dec. 5) for a left-side femoral acetabular impingement and hip labrum, per Lia Assimakopoulos of The Dallas Morning News.
Ehlers (lower body) is considered a game-time decision for Wednesday's (Dec. 18) game against the Ducks.
The Buffalo Sabres placed F Sam Lafferty on injured reserve.
The Columbus Blue Jackets placed F Yegor Chinakhov on injured reserve on Wednesday (Dec. 11).
The Flames announced that Kirkland underwent successful ACL surgery on Wednesday (Dec. 4) and he will be out for the remainder of the season.
Manson might suit up during Colorado's three-game road trip but won't be in action in Monday's (Dec. 16) against Vancouver, per Avalanche play-by-play announcer Conor McGahey.
The Utah Hockey Club said on Saturday (Nov. 30) that Lamoureux was placed on injured reserve.
Avalanche head coach Jared Bednar said on Monday (Dec. 2) that Kylington is considered week-to-week, per Bailey Curtis of The Hockey News.
The Vancouver Canucks placed D Filip Hronek on long-term injured reserve on Thursday (Dec. 5).
The Colorado Avalanche placed F Miles Wood on long-term injured reserve on Saturday (Dec.7). He is considered month-to-month, Evan Rawal of the Denver Gazette reports.
The Ottawa Senators placed D Artem Zub on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Nov. 26).
The Nashville Predators listed Lauzon as OUT for Tuesday's (Dec. 17) game versus the Rangers but is possible to return for Thursday's (Dec. 19) game versus the Penguins.
The Senators said on Tuesday (Dec. 3) that Perron is not expected to be back in the short term, per TSN 1200 Ottawa.
The Colorado Avalanche placed F Jonathan Drouin on injured reserve on Saturday (Dec. 7).
The Winnipeg Jets placed D Dylan Samberg on injured reserve on Sunday (Nov. 24).
The Utah Hockey Club said on Monday (Dec. 16) that Ingram remains out indefinitely, per Belle Fraser of The Salt Lake Tribune.
Hutton is skating on his own but is not ready to join the team yet, per Jesse Granger of The Athletic.
The Capitals said that Ovechkin did on-ice conditioning but is still OUT for Saturday's (Dec. 14) game versus the Sabres.
Bennett is OUT for Wednesday's (Dec. 18) game against Minnesota because of an illness, as per Jessi Pierce of NHL.com.
Jones is expected to miss approximately four weeks with a right foot injury, per Charlie Roumeliotis of WGN Radio.

Maple Leafs head coach Craig Berube announced on Thursday (Dec. 5) that Hakanpaa recently underwent a procedure on his knee that should allow him to resume skating soon, per David Alter of The Hockey News.
The Seattle Kraken placed F Jordan Eberle on long-term injured reserve on Saturday (Nov. 30).
Lindholm remains week-to-week, according to Conor Ryan of The Boston Globe. He is still on injured reserve and isn't close to being available to return.
The Oilers said on Tuesday (Dec. 17) that Arvidsson is probable to play in Thursday's (Dec. 19) game versus Boston..
The Washington Capitals shifted F Sonny Milano to long-term injured reserve, Stephen Whyno of the Associated Press reports.
The Flames announced that Mantha will require surgery on his ACL on Thursday (Nov. 14) and will miss the remainder of the 2024-25 season.
The Islanders said that Reilly will have a procedure on his heart on Tuesday (Nov. 19). He will be out indefinitely.
The Hurricanes announced that Andersen will undergo a procedure on his knee on Friday (Nov. 22 )which will knock him out of action about 8 weeks or so, per TSN and RDS Hockey Insider Pierre LeBrun.
The New York Islanders placed F Anthony Duclair on long-term injured reserve.
Leddy will accompany the Blues on the team's upcoming four-game road trip, per Lou Korac of NHL.com.
The Blue Jackets announced that Gudbranson underwent successful shoulder surgery on Monday (Oct. 21) and is without a timetable to return.
The Utah Hockey Club announced D Sean Durz has undergone successful shoulder surgery and is expected to return in 4-6 months.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Jakub Demek on the injured reserve non-roster list on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Jordan Gustafson on injured reserve non-roster list on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Colorado Avalanche placed D Tucker Poolman on long-term injured reserve. He didn't play in 2023-24 due to migraines and won't be available for the 2024-25 campaign either.
The Vegas Golden Knights placed D Lukas Cormier on injured reserve non-roster list on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Philadelphia Flyers placed D Ryan Ellis on injured reserve.
The Columbus Blue Jackets placed F Jordan Dumais on injured reserve.
Jenner underwent shoulder surgery on Wednesday (Oct. 9) and could return before the end of the season, per Jeff Svoboda of the Blue Jackets' official site.
The Maple Leafs said Jarnkrok had surgery to repair a sports hernia and is now considered month-to-month.

Grosenick underwent successful surgery on Wednesday (Oct. 2) to repair a torn ACL in his right knee and will not play this season. He is expected to make a full recovery and be ready for the start of the 2025-26 season.
The Canadiens said that Reinbacher underwent surgery to his left knee on Tuesday (Oct. 1) and is out for 5-to-6 months.
The Nashville Predators placed F Austin Roest on injured reserve non-roster list on Sunday (Sept. 29).
The Devils said that Hatakka underwent successful shoulder surgery on Thursday (Oct. 10) and is without a timetable to return.
Doughty is aiming to return to action in early January as long as there are no setbacks in his recovery, per Dennis Bernstein of The Fourth Period.
The Utah Hockey Club said on Wednesday (Oct. 23) that Marino underwent successful surgery and is expected to return in 3-4 months.
Vlasic is ramping up his condition, according to Sharks head coach Ryan Warsofsky. There is no clear timetable yet for his return.
Couture has not resumed skating on Friday (Nov. 1) and remains without a timeline to return, per Sheng Peng of San Jose Hockey Now.
The Edmonton Oilers placed F Evander Kane on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Oct. 8).

The Capitals said on Wednesday (Sept. 18) that Oshie will be put on long-term injured reserve due to a chronic back injury which is expected to cost him the entire 2024-25 campaign, per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
The St. Louis Blues placed D Torey Krug on long-term injured reserve on Tuesday (Oct. 8).
The Carolina Hurricanes placed F Jesper Fast on long-term injured reserve on Wednesday (Oct. 9).
Brossoit had another procedure done on Friday (Nov. 29) and is expected to be out for another six weeks, according to Blackhawks head coach Luke Richardson.
The San Jose Sharks placed F Igor Chernyshov on injured reserve on Monday (Oct. 7).
The Washington Capitals placed F Nicklas Backstrom on long-term injured reserve.
Avalanche head coach Jared Bednar said that Landeskog remains without a timetable to return, per Adrian Hernandez of SBNation.com.
